_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Overview:
The Home Market Foods, Inc. (Home Market Foods) facility, located at 140
Morgan Drive, Norwood, Massachusetts (the Property), produces and distributes
quality meat products. The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant to
maintain the proper temperature in support of production needs and for storing
the product until distribution. Anhydrous ammonia is an effective refrigerant that
has been used for many years by most food processing facilities. Ammonia is
normally a gas at ambient temperatures but is handled as a gas that is liquefied
under pressure. The refrigeration system consists of pressure vessels,
evaporators, compressors, piping and other refrigeration equipment. The same
properties that make ammonia a valuable refrigerant also make it necessary to
observe certain safety precautions during its use to prevent exposure to workers,
the surrounding community, and the environment. Please refer to Figure 1 for
the location of Property.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
Home Market Foods is committed to promoting safety for the facility, its
employees and the area surrounding its facility. Home Market Foods complies
with the Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Process Safety
Management Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations 1910.110 and
United States Environmental Protection Agencys (EPA) Risk Management
Program (RM Program) Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 68.
The purpose of these programs is to ensure that the refrigeration system is
operated safely to prevent releases of ammonia from the system. In addition, the
Home Market Foods operational procedures are established within formulated
regulatory guidelines, outlining appropriate emergency action steps to take in the
event of a release.

Five Year Update:
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) was originally developed in September 2004
by American Refrigeration, Inc. for Home Market Foods. Verdantas, LLC
(formerly Ge

oInsight, Inc). performed the requisite regulatory update necessary
for covered facilities on their initial five year RMP submission anniversary date of
September 24, 2009, and conducted the same task in the succeeding five year
update(s) on September 24, 2014, September 24, 2019 and September 24,
2024. This 2024 update includes reporting of an accidental release which
occurred in December 2022 and updated worst case and alternate case
scenarios.

Regulated Substance:
Home Market Foods operates a refrigeration system utilizing anhydrous
ammonia as the primary refrigerant. Mechanical refrigeration is a
thermodynamic process where the refrigerant, ammonia, is used as a heat
exchanging fluid to maintain a desired temperature in an enclosed environment.
The refrigeration cycle consists of evaporation, compression, condensation and
expansion. Evaporation and condensation are designed to alter the quantity of
energy associated with the refrigerant. Compression and expansion are
designed to change the availability of the associated energy. The refrigeration
cycle is a closed-loop process. The ammonia cycle utilizes fluid temperature,
pressure and latent heat of vaporization for cooling. The refrigeration system
uses this phenomenon to remove heat from a desired space, and then to discard
that heat through condensation.
Home Market Foods operates its main machine room (having compressors,
condenser, receivers), as well as the low pressure side of the system
(pump receivers, coil evaporators, water chillers and coolers) to maintain
processing, freezer and holding room temperatures required for manufacturing of
and storage of their product. There are approximately 400 employees that work
at the Home Market Foods facility, including hourly and salary personnel that
support manufacturing and logistics relating to product preparation and product
shipment. Home Market Foods operates approximately 24 hours a day, five
days a week.
Aggregate ammonia storage is 25,592 pounds (lbs).

rvative measure. As the September 3, 2024 release was not
considered an RMP reportable incident, an Accident Response Reporting sheet
was not prepared.

Steps to Improve Safety:
Home Market Foods takes a hands-on approach to ensuring the safety of their
employees and community. Home Market Foods will operate and maintain the
system in accordance with IIAR Guidance and will continue to implement its
OSHA PSM Program in conjunction with the RM Program.
Following the December 2022 ammonia release, Home Market Foods modified
internal training procedures, and contractor training and sign-in procedures to
improve employee and contractor awareness when working in areas near the
ammonia system.
